item.description: Freebie: Designing for User Experience Poster http://ff.im/-E8t4Z
item.content:encoded: Freebie: Designing for User Experience Poster http://ff.im/-E8t4Z Mike Finch is a firm believer that “UX” is a verb- not a noun. It’s a process, and he believes that if documented and followed correctly, it’s a process that anyone can have a reasonable amount of success with. As professionals, we need to shout these solutions from the rooftops- not keep them as guarded secrets. To that end, Mike has outlined his personal process when designing for user experience and made this awesome poster for your office wall. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: fuelyourcreativity.com

item.title: Severe weather continues in central US - The Big Picture - Boston.com
item.description: Unbelievable photographs from Joplin, MO. http://ow.ly/534Of
item.content:encoded: Unbelievable photographs from Joplin, MO. http://ow.ly/534Of Deadly storms struck again yesterday in the states of Arkansas, Oklahoma, and Kansas. It was a storm system that followed the massive, highest-rated EF5 twister that struck Joplin, Mo., on Sunday. The Joplin twister, which killed more than 120 people, is the eighth deadliest storm on record in the United States dating back to 1840. This year's tornado season has produced approximately 1,000 twisters and has taken the lives of more than 300 people. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: boston.com

item.title: And The Winner Of TechCrunch Disrupt NYC Is…Getaround!
item.description: And The Winner Of TechCrunch Disrupt NYC Is...Getaround! http://tcrn.ch/kRgQ3X by @leenarao
item.content:encoded: And The Winner Of TechCrunch Disrupt NYC Is...Getaround! http://tcrn.ch/kRgQ3X by @leenarao Three days and 32 startup pitches later, the winner of TechCrunch Disrupt has been determined. Out of the 30 startups and two audience choice winners, we whittled the list down to six finalists, which include Billguard, ccLoop, Do@, Getaround, InvoiceASAP, and Sonar. Without further ado, the two runners-up are Billguard and Sonar (that's the first time we've had two runners-up). And the winner is....Getaround! Getaround is a car rental market place where you can rent a car by the day, hour or week through a smartphone app. Getaround’s all inclusive package, which includes insurance, 24 hour roadside assistance, a Getaround car-kit, iPhone app and a web app makes it easy for people to conveniently car share anywhere. The company’s founder said today that currently the startup has signed up 1,600 cars for sharing since its launch yesterday, which is 20 percent of car-sharing giant Zipcar’s fleet of 8,000 cars. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.content:encoded: What should I do about FunnyJunk.com? http://bit.ly/mKEJQc 4. Cash six figure advertising checks from other artist's stolen Link - Trackbacks

item.title: LinkedIn Labs Launches "This is Your Life" Visualization
item.description: LinkedIn Labs Launches "This is Your Life" Visualization http://rww.to/kHeNyh
item.content:encoded: LinkedIn Labs Launches "This is Your Life" Visualization http://rww.to/kHeNyh LinkedIn showed off a new addition to its Lab site today called the LinkedIn Connection Timeline. It's a very fun way to remember people you used to work with throughout the years - and see where they are now. Built internally by LinkedIn's Gordon Koo, the visualization does a good job illustrating the tip of the iceberg of what structured, social data can provide when accessed programmatically. And it's fun. It brings to mind the app Memolane and makes me wish someone would build something like this for Twitter or Facebook. Take the list of people I'm connected to... Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: readwriteweb.com

item.content:encoded: Whoops: NFC Partner Spoils Google's Surprise Tomorrow. ViVOtech One Partner. Citibank Too? http://tcrn.ch/ijZuxO by @parislemon Google is holding an event tomorrow in New York City. While everyone seems to be aware that it's a partner event to announce the NFC strategy for their Android phones, Google has refused to confirm it. Well, they don't have to. One of their partners just did. We just got an email from the PR firm representing ViVOtech, wondering if we were going to the Google event tomorrow. They try to talk vaguely about  Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Getaround Signed Up 1,600 Cars In A Day; That’s 20 Percent Of Zipcar’s Fleet
item.description: Getaround Signed Up 1,600 Cars In A Day; That's 20 Percent Of Zipcar's Fleet http://tcrn.ch/ipgNJ7 by @leenarao
item.content:encoded: Getaround Signed Up 1,600 Cars In A Day; That's 20 Percent Of Zipcar's Fleet http://tcrn.ch/ipgNJ7 by @leenarao TechCrunch Disrupt Battlefield finalist Getaround is already disrupting the current car sharing industry, only a day after its launch. As we wrote yesterday, GetAround is a car rental market place where you can rent a car by the day, hour or week through a smartphone app. Getaround’s all inclusive package, which includes insurance, 24 hour roadside assistance, a Getaround car-kit, iPhone app and a web app makes it easy for people to conveniently car share any where. Today, the company's founder said that since its launch yesterday the startup has signed up 1,600 cars for sharing. That's 20 percent of car-sharing giant Zipcar's fleet of 8,000 cars. Impressive for a bootstrapped startup that has only been open to the public for a matter of hours. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

When Martin replied that Sonar took around $250K to date to build, Arrington commented, Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Which Direction Should I Wipe?
item.description: Um...are you, uh, wiping yourself properly? Seriously, there's more to the task than you may realize: http://t.co/LFIBrhI
item.content:encoded: Um...are you, uh, wiping yourself properly? Seriously, there's more to the task than you may realize: http://t.co/LFIBrhI You probably don't remember who taught you how to wipe—your parents, most likely—or why you wipe the way you do. All you know is that once you were settled in on one style of wiping that worked, more or less, there was no real reason to change. But is it the right way? Is it the best way? Let's find out. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: lifehacker.com

item.title: Behold: TechCrunch Erupt In Iceland (Pictures)
item.description: Behold: TechCrunch Erupt In Iceland (Pictures) http://tcrn.ch/kWwvY4 by @parislemon
item.content:encoded: Behold: TechCrunch Erupt In Iceland (Pictures) http://tcrn.ch/kWwvY4 by @parislemon As some of you may have read, I was all set to step on a plane on Sunday to head to New York City for TechCrunch Disrupt. Then a giant volcano exploded. But being stranded in Iceland wasn't all bad. First of all, it's a beautiful country. Second, when some local entrepreneurs read about our misfortune, they got together and organized an event: TechCrunch Erupt. My friends and I headed over to the event on Monday for conversation, beer, and livestreaming of TechCrunch Disrupt from the U.S. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.description: Sen. Franken presses Apple, Google again over app store privacy http://tinyurl.com/3c96ndk
item.content:encoded: Sen. Franken presses Apple, Google again over app store privacy http://tinyurl.com/3c96ndk Senator Al Franken (D-MN) has once again put pressure on Apple and Google over their app store privacy policies. The Senator wants each company to require third-parties to post their own policies, even though he acknowledges that most privacy concerns wouldn't be addressed by this. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: arstechnica.com
